Â 911 Call #3Â audio shows that from the time this 911 call was received for approximately the next 45 seconds repeated audible cries can be heard in the background.Â Â During the conversation with the 911 operator, the female caller describes someone â€œscreaming outsideâ€. She indicates that she believes the person is yelling for help, but she does not know why.Â At about :45 into the call,Â a loud noise can be heard and the caller indicates she has just heard a single gunshot.Â After this point, the screams stop and do not continue.Â It must be surmised that the screaming that the woman heard began at some point before her call to 911. Â Officer Timothy Smith (from preliminary police report dated 27 Feb 12 at 0329 hrs):Â Officer Smith responded to a report of a suspicious person at about 1917 hours.Â As he was arriving, he received transmissions that gunshots had been fired in the same subdivision.Â According to Officer Smith, â€œI asked the subject in the red jacket, later identified as George Zimmerman (who was original caller for the suspicious person complaint), if he had seen the subject.Â Zimmerman stated that he had shot the subject and was still armed.Â Zimmerman complied with all my verbal commands and was secured in handcuffs.Â Located on the inside of Zimmermanâ€™s waistband, I removed a black Kel Tek 9mm semi automatic handgun and holster. Conclusion:Â Trayvon Martin attacked George Zimmerman, and after nearly a minute - perhaps longer - of crying out for help, Zimmerman used justifiable deadly force and took Trayvon Martin's life.Â A tragedy any way you look at it, but not a criminal Act by Zimmerman.
